intro: Sticherus pedalis, commonly known as the creeping sticherus, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender, often hairy stems that form dense mats on the ground. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and divided into narrow lobes, giving the plant a delicate appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
